intro: Monteverdia revoluta var. bissei, commonly known as the velvetleaf monteverdia, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in subtropical gardens.
